title: Kelela to Release New In the Blue Light Live Album
description: The singer and her band recorded the new album at New York’s Blue Note
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: The singer and her band recorded the new album at New York’s Blue Note

html:
The singer and her band recorded the new album at New York’s Blue Note

Kelela is releasing a new live album that she and her band recorded last year at New York’s Blue Note. The album, In the Blue Light, is out February 11 via Warp. Listen to “Better (Unplugged)” below.

In the Blue Light captures live renditions of songs from Cut 4 Me, Hallucinogen, Take Me Apart, and Raven. It also includes a covers of Joni Mitchell’s “Furry Sings the Blues.”

Kelela has been going to the Blue Note since she was a teenager, discussing her love for the in interviews with Pitchfork and GQ.

In the Blue Light:

01 Enemy (Unplugged)
02 Raven (Unplugged)
03 Take Me Apart (Unplugged)
04 Bankhead (Unplugged)
05 Waitin’ (Unplugged)
06 30 Years (Unplugged)
07 All the Way Down (Unplugged)
08 Furry Sings the Blues (Unplugged)
09 Blue Light (Unplugged)
10 Love Notes (Unplugged)
11 Better (Unplugged)
12 Cherry Coffee (Unplugged)

Matthew Strauss is a Long Island native and a graduate of Columbia University. He joined Pitchfork in 2013.
